intro: Caroselinum distans, commonly known as the distant caroselinum, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
